rootCause: Exploitation of a buffer overflow vulnerability in Microsoft's Internet Information Services (IIS) web server software.
impact: Infected over 359,000 servers in less than 14 hours, defacing websites with the message 'Hacked By Chinese!' and launching DDoS attacks against the White House website.
description: The Code Red worm caused widespread disruption by exploiting a common vulnerability in Microsoft IIS. Its rapid propagation and high-profile targets demonstrated the potential for automated threats to spread globally in a matter of hours.

sources.title: Code Red's second wave crashes servers

rootCause: The Nimda worm used five different infection vectors, including email, open network shares, and web server vulnerabilities.
impact: Caused massive network slowdowns and disruption worldwide. It became the internet's most widespread virus in just 22 minutes.
description: Nimda ('admin' spelled backward) was a complex computer worm that spread rapidly across the internet. Its multi-pronged approach to propagation made it highly effective and difficult to contain, causing significant economic damage and network congestion.

sources.title: Nimda worm slithers across the Net
